title: Solomon's Wisdom and Wealth
shortSummary: This chapter highlights the visit of the queen of Sheba, who comes to test Solomon's renowned wisdom and is overwhelmed by his God-given understanding and prosperity. It also details Solomon's immense wealth, his royal splendor, and the extensive trade and military resources that established Israel’s prominence under his reign.
timeline: c. 970 BC - Reign of King Solomon in Israel

keyCharacters.name: Solomon
keyCharacters.description: King of Israel, renowned for his wisdom, wealth, and building projects, including the temple of the LORD.

keyCharacters.name: Queen of Sheba
keyCharacters.description: A foreign monarch who visits Solomon to test his wisdom with difficult questions and is impressed by his God-given understanding and riches.

keyCharacters.name: Hiram
keyCharacters.description: King of Tyre, allied with Solomon, whose navy brought valuable goods such as gold and almug trees from Ophir.

definitions.definition: A large unit of weight and currency used in ancient times, often representing a significant amount of gold or silver.
Rare and valuable trees imported from Ophir, used for pillars and musical instruments in Solomon’s temple and palace.
Royal officials who served drinks to the king, symbolizing trusted attendants in the royal court.
A fleet of ships engaged in long-distance trade, bringing exotic goods like gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks to Solomon.

outline.heading: The Queen of Sheba Tests Solomon’s Wisdom
outline.description: The queen of Sheba visits Solomon with difficult questions to test his wisdom. She is overwhelmed by his answers, his wealth, and the splendor of his court, recognizing the hand of God in his reign.

outline.heading: The Queen of Sheba’s Praise and Gifts
outline.description: After witnessing Solomon’s wisdom and prosperity, the queen praises the LORD and Solomon, giving him lavish gifts. Solomon grants her every request, demonstrating his generosity and the respect he commands.

outline.heading: Solomon’s Wealth and Splendor
outline.description: The chapter details Solomon’s vast accumulation of gold, his ornate throne, shields, and drinking vessels, illustrating the extraordinary wealth and glory God bestowed upon him.

outline.heading: Solomon’s Trade and Military Power
outline.description: Solomon’s navy and merchants engage in extensive trade, bringing valuable goods from distant lands. He also builds a powerful military force, including chariots and horsemen, securing Israel’s strength and influence.

application: Seek God’s wisdom earnestly, trusting that He grants understanding beyond human ability as He did for Solomon.
Recognize and give thanks for God’s blessings in your life, using them to glorify Him and serve others generously.
Value the testimony of others about God’s work in your life, allowing it to strengthen your faith and witness.
Commit your resources and abilities to God’s service, remembering that all prosperity is ultimately from Him.

keyVerses.text: And she said to the king, It was a true report that I heard in mine own land of thy acts and of thy wisdom.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the confirmation of Solomon’s God-given wisdom and the fulfillment of God’s promises through his reign.

keyVerses.text: So king Solomon exceeded all the kings of the earth for riches and for wisdom.
keyVerses.significance: It summarizes Solomon’s unparalleled wisdom and wealth, underscoring God’s blessing on a faithful king.

keyVerses.text: Blessed be the LORD thy God, which delighted in thee, to set thee on the throne of Israel: because the LORD loved Israel for ever, therefore made he thee king, to do judgment and justice.
keyVerses.significance: This verse acknowledges God’s sovereign choice and purpose in establishing Solomon’s reign for righteous governance.
